name: bmc-ted-extension
description: BMC AMI DevX Data Studio is a data management product with automation to speed data extraction, privatization and loading. The extension allows Azure Devops users to run ted specifications.
author: BMC Software

inputs.name: windowsTopazWorkbenchCliHome
inputs.label: Windows Workbench CLI Home
inputs.helpMarkDown: This field specifies the path of installed Workbench CLI. This can be configured in the Common Configuration Extension.

inputs.name: linuxTopazWorkbenchCliHome
inputs.label: Linux  Workbench CLI Home
inputs.helpMarkDown: This field specifies the path of installed  Workbench CLI. This can be configured in the Common Configuration Extension.

inputs.name: repositoryName
inputs.label: Repository Name
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The name of the File-AID EX repository, which houses the required EX specifications that are to be executed.

 Optional? No 

 Can be defined in execution Context? No

inputs.name: resultRepositoryName
inputs.label: Results Repository Name
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The repository where Compare Pro execution results will be stored. Only applicable to comparePro specifications.

 Optional? Yes, defaults to the specification repository if not specified.

Can be defined in execution Context? No

inputs.name: executionOptions
inputs.label: Execution Type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose an option

inputs.name: specificationName
inputs.label: Specification Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the specification that is to be executed. Required if single specification execution is selected.Optional? No, mandatory if single specification execution is selected.

inputs.name: specificationType
inputs.label: Specification Type
inputs.helpMarkDown: The type of the specification that is to be executed. Optional? No, mandatory if single specification execution is selected.

inputs.name: multiSpecificationExecution
inputs.label: Specification Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the specification that is to be executed. Required if single specification execution is selected.Optional? No, mandatory if single specification execution is selected.

inputs.name: exitOnFailure
inputs.label: Exit on Failure
inputs.helpMarkDown: Flag to denote if it is preferred to stop the continued execution of specifications after a execution failure, in case of multi-specification execution.Optional? Yes, defaulted to true if not defined

inputs.name: executionContext
inputs.label: Execution Context
inputs.helpMarkDown:
TThe name of the execution context file. If the file is present at /WorkbenchCLI/EnterpriseData, the name of the file would suffice, if at a different location on the machine supply the

 full path with the file name. If a value for a certain argument is defined in the context file and is also passed as an argument, the value passed with the command will take precedence. To know which all parameters can be specified via the context file, view the template provided at /WorkbenchCLI/EnterpriseData named executioncontext_template.properties. Multiple execution contexts can be created as required by copying the template.Optional? Yes, if this is not provided all other mandatory parameters have to be defined on the pipeline definition.

inputs.name: executionTimeout
inputs.label: Execution Timeout
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The execution timeout in seconds. The default if not defined is 20 seconds.Optional? Yes 

 Can be defined in execution Context? Yes

inputs.name: defineCes
inputs.label: Define CES
inputs.helpMarkDown: Flag to denote if it is preferred to stop the continued execution of specifications after a execution failure, in case of multi-specification execution.Optional? Yes, defaulted to true if not defined

inputs.name: cesUri
inputs.label: Host Connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: This field specifies the host connection to use to submit a measurement.Host connections can be configured in the Common Configuration Extension.

inputs.name: useCloudCes
inputs.label: Use Cloud CES
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Flag to denote if cloud CES should be used. 

Optional? No

inputs.name: customerNumber
inputs.label: Customer Number
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The customer number, in case the cloud CES is chosen to be used. Please contact BMC customer support if you need help with this information.

 Optional? Required for cloud CES.

inputs.name: siteID
inputs.label: Site ID
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The Site ID, in case the cloud CES is chosen to be used. Please contact BMC customer support if you need help with this information.

Optional? Required for cloud CES.

inputs.name: defineCommManager
inputs.label: Define Communication Manager
inputs.helpMarkDown: Flag to denote if it is preferred to stop the continued execution of specifications after a execution failure, in case of multi-specification execution.Optional? Yes, defaulted to true if not defined

inputs.name: host
inputs.label: Host
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The host name or ip of the machine where the communication manager is running. The File-AID Ex repository containing the specifications that needs to be executed should be configured on this communication manager.

Optional? No

Can be defined in execution Context? Yes

inputs.name: port
inputs.label: Port
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The port on which the communication manager is running. on the specified host.

Optional? No

Can be defined in execution Context? Yes

inputs.name: defineExecServer
inputs.label: Define Execution Server
inputs.helpMarkDown: Flag to denote if it is preferred to stop the continued execution of specifications after a execution failure, in case of multi-specification execution.Optional? Yes, defaulted to true if not defined

inputs.name: execServerHost
inputs.label: Host
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The host name or ip of the machine which the execution server where the EX specifications should be executed, is installed.

Optional? Required for executing EX specifications.

Can be defined in execution Context? Yes

inputs.name: execServerPort
inputs.label: Port
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The host name or ip of the machine which the execution server where the EX specifications should be executed, is installed.

Optional? Required for executing EX specifications.

Can be defined in execution Context? Yes

inputs.name: defineExecHost
inputs.label: Define Execution Host
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The execution host and port where RDX specifications should be executed.

Optional? Required for executing RDX specifications.

Can be defined in execution Context? Yes

inputs.name: execConnectionId
inputs.label: Host Connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: This field specifies the host connection to use to submit a measurement.Host connections can be configured in the Common Configuration Extension.

inputs.name: useCredentials
inputs.label: Use credentials for authentication
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The execution host and port where RDX specifications should be executed.

Optional? Required for executing RDX specifications.

Can be defined in execution Context? Yes

inputs.name: exexHostCredentials
inputs.label: Credentials
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The credentials name from Azure Key Vault for the selected execution host.
